intro: Ganophyllum, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Montiaceae. It consists of several species that are typically found in arid or semi-arid regions, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. The plants are characterized by their small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves, which help them conserve water in harsh environments. Ganophyllum species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and drought tolerance.
